author: tpalshadow
title: So Close to Perfection!
content:
This watch is nearly perfect.  I'll outline the Pros and Cons below, but they could very easily make an app change which, in my mind, would make this a five star product.  I'm not sure if it would be a Google or Samsung change, but it would set this watch apart.

Pros:
- The looks.  I am 6', average build and I think it looks great.  As with many modern watches it is large, but not overly big in my opinion.
- Tactile feel. I like the rotating bezel.  For me it is intuitive to use and clicks in nicely.  The touchscreen is responsive and accurate.  For me I wish the back button was the bottom button, but once I trained myself it is a non-issue.
- Display. It really is nice looking.  When used in the always on mode I have had multiple people tell me they had no idea it was a digital watch.
- Function. Apart from the one major con below, the watch does everything I need it to seamlessly.  Alerts are timely and there is almost zero lag in function.  Everything flows nicely and the shortcuts are great.
- Samsung Pay!  I have been using SP on my S7 Edge for quite a while and it is so much more efficient on the watch.  It is faster (no fingerprint) and to me it seems to work from greater distance than the phone.  It is kind of funny some of the looks tellers give you when you pay with your watch.  (Many times they will say something like, oh we don't have that here. -BEEP- Wow, how did you do that.)
- Battery Life. First let me say I typically run the watch with Always On turned off.  I do occasionally turn it on, but for me I typically leave it off.  My normal daily procedure is to wear the watch all day and then at night to track my sleep.  When I wake to shower and eat breakfast I'll take the watch off (it is normally from 70-80% charged still) and place it on the charger.  By the time I head out the door for work it is back at 100%.

Cons:
- The one MAJOR problem I have with this watch is the lack of integration with Google.  I can't wrap my head around why this is set up this way, but it is very frustrating.  I would consider myself a heavy Google user.  Unfortunately I have had to stop using the Google GMail and Messenger apps.  The reason I have stopped using them is you can receive and reply to messages from these apps, but you cannot initiate a message.  It is really too bad because for me they are far better than the S7 Edge's messenger and email program.  I also NEED to see programs such as Maps run natively on the watch.  Yes there are alternative mapping programs you can install on the watch, but they fall far short of Google's own apps.  This watch would be a hands down 5 star device if Google apps ran natively on it.
- The other issue I have occasionally had is the watch recognizing I am looking at it and turning the screen on (this is with Always On turned off). I don't know if it the way I hold my arm, wrist, or something else I'm doing wrong; but from time to time I have to hit a button or spin the bezel to turn on the screen.

Overall I'm very impressed with the watch.  Feel free to ask any questions or leave any comments.

author: Orcatrainer
title: Works like a charm right out of the box with my Samsung Galaxy S7
content:
I am one of those unlucky one who got scammed on "Indiegogo" about the "Cronovo" smart watch. So after giving up on that one and some more research I decided to go with the Gear S3. Especially attracted by the Frontier, since it has a bigger and more "adventurer" design than the regular or "sport" one. Plus, I have a quite large wrist, so that was also a perfect fit for me. But in case the band was too big (long), they also added in the box a smaller (shorter) one.

Worked perfectly right out of the box, after the initial required full charge (the watch was at 50% when I received it). Setup may be a bit complicated for those who aren't used to smart watch, so I advice you to read the user manual that comes with it (or watch YouTube video about the watch and how to set it up). Also, after the first setup, Samsung send you an email reminding you of your watch serial number (useful if your watch got stolen), along with the user manual in .PDF format, which is much more easier to read than the included small paper version, and also search-able too.

I had a Android watch before, so using this one and set it up was pretty straight forward for me, even if this is a Samsung Gear watch and not Android specific watch. Which means there may be some Android apps that will not be compatible with it. But so far, all the apps I used with my old Android watch, works fine with this one. Some review state that Samsung do not have enough apps selection, but so far I was happy with the quite a great selection of apps available, so I was able to choose a neat face watch, along with some other great apps I needed for the watch.

Heart monitor works flawlessly, but I do have to tighten the watch a little bit more for it to read the hear beats accurately. Love the turning bezel as well, and it give a nice genuine watch look to it. Matter of fact, if I change the watch face to be a classic one with analog display (the needles one), the watch look like if it was one of those genuine expensive analog one. The screen resolution is so great and bright (even outside), that if you don't look closer you really think that those needles pointing at the time are real.

On the battery side, I have everything on in the watch (except GPS for now), and it run for about 1 day and 20 hours without a charge. If I select "power saving" mode, then I could have up to 4 days of battery without charging the watch. Although, I have a habit to charge it every night before bed, so that's not a problem for me to leave all the gadgets on, and I can fully enjoy the watch and its performance.

In short this was a great buy, which I definitely recommend if you're looking for a new smart watch, or replacement to an old one.

author: Eleassar F.
title: Expensive smartwatch feels like a cheap, slow watch
content:
The Samsung Galaxy Gear S3 definitely is/ was one of the best smartwatches. The battery life is great, pairing is easy, and the fact that you can text and call from it can be convenient. I love how it works with my S8+, as if they were made for each other (well, they were). The options of different bands and watch faces is cool, as well as even placing a cover on it to completely change the color. The screen is bright, and can be dim. There are many things this watch does good- and believe me it's an amazing smartwatch! Except mine is a mess.
I'm honestly not sure what the issue is. I have tizen 4, I only have 3 watchfaces installed, and have so little apps that can be uninstalled. And yet my watch lags. It's been lagging since I got it, lagging after uninstalling almost everything, removing widgets, reset, etc. And yet it lags. Raising your wrist to see the time can sometimes take as much as 2 seconds! And receiving a notification and checking it by raising the wrist is an awful 4-5 seconds. Pressing the notification has a delay. Choosing the text option has a delay. Load, load, I can now type. Now I can send- delay. It's slow and tedious.
Loading up apps- delay and slow
Reading messages- delay and slow
Responding to messages- so slow and delayed its quicker to pull out your phone and type the same message-20 times... From when you receive the notification, to when your message sends on your watch. Now typing on a smartwatch is going to be slow, but what kills it is the lag of loading and reading the message, pressing anything on the watch to respond to it or show on the phone, or even opening the messaging app. I can't believe this costed me $250- for a watch that just feels slow. Even using the bezel to go through the little widgets I have can be slow. I clear my apps, reset it, all of that. This watch is a disappointment. At this point it's only good for fashion and step tracking. It can do many more features, but it's so slow it's just a complete turn off.
This review is after half a year of usage.

author: TED T
title: Great features, Battery life terrible
content: 15 months since purchase.  Firmware update every couple months changed how it charges & uses battery,  First few caused watch to over-heat so it shut down charging, then it would only charge to 78%, now it charges to reported 100% but that 100% is less than 50% of original battery capacity, now battery only lasts about 18 hours (set medium brightness, turn off display after a couple seconds).  I wanted to monitor sleep, and activity during the day, but I have to charge it about 3x per day or it will go into power saving mode.  Fitness app doesn't show heart rate throughout the day, only when you open app and tell it to measure (can't use workout mode for heart rate monitoring, because battery dies very quickly!).  Previous tracker was Jawbone UP III, and it would plot heart rate for entire 24 hour period, monitor sleep, and charge every 2.5 days, I have to keep a charger at work, one by the bed, and one in the living room and put it on charger anytime I'm not moving, or battery dies.  Display is great, it's lasted well (except band failed within 3 weeks), I use a screen protector.  Factory charger,cable,adapter still occasionally warn that I need to use original charger, after-market charger purchased recently for the office also occasionally generates that warning.  Other chargers purchased previously have been disabled by firmware updates that prevent use of  non-Samsung charger.  I LIKE the features, but would not buy this model due to lousy battery life.

If you buy this watch from this vendor you can save almost $40.

The potential problem with a NON-US version is that it may require to use older versions of the corresponding phone app to support all the expected functionality of the watch, and then your phone may not support other newer Samsung wearables.  Still it may operable in the US, but perhaps not exactly the same as the US version.  For most it may be a minor inconvenience, but I wanted full US functionality as I had with my previous S2.

As always, Amazon was prompt to refund the moneys when I returned the watch.  Thanks.

author: George Seirlis
title: and that makes it the perfect solution for me
content:
To begin with, the Gear S3 is no gimmick.
I work in a very loud environment, where it's not practical to keep your phone in your pocket. So I'd always miss calls and messages. Even when I did try and keep my phone with me, I wouldn't hear alerts, or feel the phone vibrate due to the machines surrounding me.

With the Gear S3, I still can't hear anything come through, but I can feel the watch vibrate due to it being strapped to my wrist.

Since I've had the S3, I've never missed an important call or message, and that makes it the perfect solution for me.

It's made such a difference that 3 others whom work with me, have gone out and bought one too.

I turned off the always on display, and chose a watch face with a black background, and I get between 3 and 4 days with a single charge, with general usage.

I recommend the S3 to anyone working long hours, and/or in noisy conditions.

author: Shivan Rajcoomar

author: Hodgepodgerama
title: I've had it with this watch!  Buggy.  Overly complicated.  Looking for something else.
content:
Update at the end of this review...

Highlights:
Looks nice.
Reasonable selection of apps
Many watch face screens available

Problems:
Very poor battery life.  Less than a day in many cases if you use many watch apps for workouts, GPS, etc.
Only one alert tone leaves you wondering what you got an alert for.  This is truly awful.
All alerts are grouped together with minimal ability to turn them off.  This even includes stupid Samsung or carrier ads.
Very few useful watch faces
The text is often very small and difficult to read.  No easy-to-read options for many apps.  No way to enlarge fonts.
The watch goes brain dead at least daily for a minute or two.  Totally dark.  Resumes by itself.
Apps are often VERY SLOW. (For example it sometimes takes several seconds for steps to update once you are on that screen. Nearly all screens show old info for at least a second, then update.)
The Samsung Health app takes over the watch so you can't see other alerts or manage other apps while it is running (i.e. using S Health on a treadmill? Sorry, regular heartrate screen not available and SH heartrate too small to read or not updating.)
The heartrate monitor is generally pretty awful compared to the others I've used.
The watch restarts PHONE apps randomly. (i.e. Pandora on the PHONE starts playing by itself in the mddle of the night for no reason because you left the app open on your PHONE and the WATCH told it to start playing.)  Read that again.  It is really wierd and a known bug.
When you are playing music through your phone, your PHONE stops playing music when your WATCH moves out of bluetooth range and does not restart when you return.  You have to restart the music on the phone. (This is more annoying than you can imagine.)  No way to fix this other than turning off Bluetooth on your watch.  Known bug.
Is that enough?  I can go on.

This is my third smartwatch.  My first was a Fitbit Surge back in 2015.  That watch was a GREAT fitness tracker and had some basic smartwatch features like email/text alerts. What was nice about it was that every function I needed was only a click or two away.  Hop on a treadmill, push 2 buttons, tracking starts.  I also have an Apple 2 watch, which in hindsight did everything I needed it to, but many functions were more like 4 or 5 swipes/clicks away.  That might sound dumb, but when you are 4 or 5 swipes/clicks away from everything you use regularly, it starts to be a pain.  This Samsung Gear 3 watch?  It is...different.  It took months to get used to some of the  ways it handles things.  Rotating the bezzle is cool but kind of a chore and difficult to do precisely.  Swiping only works well if you set up your apps in the order you expect to use them. The standard app menu is awful.  And messages?  OMG this thing makes noise all the damn time and I can never figure out what kind of message I have gotten because the watch only has ONE ALERT TONE!  You swipe or rotate left to see message alerts.  You have to manually delete old alerts.

OK, I'm just going to stop here.  The phone has many good ideas in concept, but it is pretty awful in actual use.  The software just doesn't work well enough for me to recommend it.

Update:  The watch will no longer hold a charge for a full day, going completely dead by 6:00 pm.  I've had this watch for a little over a year now and the battery is already fried????  I decided to continue to use this watch until the next generation Apple phone comes out and then I'll be switching back....if I can last another month.

author: KenInTX
title: From awesome to garbage in just one update. (Update below - back to awesome!)
content:
This little watch was awesome when I got it as a birthday gift from my wife. I didn't really think I'd care much for a smartwatch, having always worn an analog watch through my adult life. But after I received it and was able to change the watch faces - how cool is that? Okay, what else can this little thing do? Well, it can measure your heartbeat - neat - oh wait, it can track my steps too? Okay - so now I can see if I've been a lazy fat butt. Now it's telling me I'm really lazy and should do a torso twist. Thanks, but I'm in the middle of an important meeting with a customer. I'm sure they'd appreciate it if I did a "torso twist" in the middle of our meeting because my watch said to. So what else - there's some apps out there, you can get navigation, which sounds neat but the reality is, I'm over 40 and can't see up close that great when I'm wearing my contacts. Last thing I need to be doing while driving is squinting to look at my watch for directions. Then there's weather, and the fact that I can do the Dick Tracy thing (call someone or receive a call) on my watch. (If you don't know who Dick Tracy is, Google it.) That's come in handy several times. I'm able to text (though if you're a long-time user of Google Voice like I am, it will use your paired device's number to send/reply with and not your GV number.) Wish there was a GV app for this! There's a weather app in case you don't go outside (why do you care about the weather if you're only inside? Go look out a window already!)  I even found a nifty Powerpoint app that I can link my watch to my laptop and use it as a remote. That is, until the watch goes to sleep in the middle of a slideshow. Everything in the Tizen OS seems to be nice and fast, no lagging at all. Keep in mind, this is not a Google or Android OS, it's Samsung's proprietary OS, they have their own apps for it, and the app store is somewhat lacking in my opinion. I wanted a simple stock ticker but apparently to do that, you have to have a constantly-on connection with your phone to receive updates as well as a separate app on your phone.

I kept getting this popup on the watch when I'd hit he buttons wrong - "Try Samsung Pay!" Finally, I broke down and decided to give it a try. I read up on the whole "LoopPay" setup and realized - this could actually be kinda cool! I setup a couple of cards in the system and decided to give it a shot at a few places while on a business trip. The area I was in was very tech saavy so most places had Near Field Communications (NFC) POS terminals. Beep! Payment accepted. Whoa. This is cool! Then, back to where I live - out in the country where some merchants still take checks. I nervously walked up to the POS terminal - everything I read says this should work. No NFC tap-type POS terminal here, just an older swipe terminal. Alright, deep breath - look for the mag-stripe read heads, hover the watch over it - BEEP - payment accepted. The clerk gives me this WTF look and said "is that Apple Pay?? I didn't think we could do that!" Then I have to explain to them, no, it's a special watch that can do this pretty much anywhere because it emulates a card swipe. The looks I get when I do this at these rinky-dink out-in-the-middle-of-nowhere merchants are priceless. Everything from the hair-grabbing "ER MEH GERD!" to open-mouthed googly-eyes. Once in a while I get someone giving me that skeptical "are you trying to hack us?" look, but it's extremely rare. I will warn you, if you use it at Wal-Mart they think you're using their Wal-Mart pay thing.

So now you're thinking - okay, this actually sounds pretty darn cool - why the heck did you give it one star? Sometime early in 2018, they issued out new firmware. Being that I keep my equipment updated, I went ahead and did it. (After all, it does nag you to do it all the time anyway.) I had no indication that this could be problematic. Update done. Supposed to "fix battery problems" they said. Wait, I was getting a whole day out of my watch, now I'm getting maybe 3-4 hours? That didn't fix anything, it made it worse! Well at least the Samsung Pay thing is pretty cool. That is, now the update causes the whole watch to completely shut down after I use Samsung Pay. I have to start it back up. This goes on for several weeks and I realize - the update has completely hosed my really cool watch. So I read up and sure enough, LOTS of people are complaining about this update. Not just a handful, but a LOT. Check YouTube. Okay, so what can I do to see if I can fix it? Reset it, everyone says - as a troubleshooting measure. Nice, now all my settings are gone (note to myself and others - you CAN backup your settings so you don't lose them through the phone app!) Still, no dice. Watch still has horrible battery life, yet when I put it on the charger it says 95% after it dies? I called Samsung support and they didn't even question me other than asking if I had tried resetting it. They didn't even flinch - here's your ticket number and a UPS label to send it back. Today, I tried to turn it on, and can't even get it to turn on after being on the charger all night. Today it goes to UPS and off to a "repair center" for 9-11 business days. I'll update this review once I get it back and have it for a week or two to see if it's fixed.

Update 6/22/2018 - I received the watch back, even though it was out of warranty they apparently opted to fix it for free since the update apparently caused the issue. They had it back to me within their 9-11 days easily so it wasn't gone too long. So far it's functioning like it used to before the update and I'm enjoying it again! Of course it was reset when I received it so I had to set everything up again, but while it was gone I discovered Samsung has a watch face designer where I was able to import a watch design I liked into the watch from a website.I also bought a Fossil Q gen 3 watch while this one was out for repair and while it's fairly nice, it doesn't even compare to this one. Lots more features and I still really like the ability to use Samsung Pay directly on the watch. (Lots of my local haunts know me as the guy that pays with his watch.)

author: dsunhawk

author: Josh

author: Hani Chaabo
title: DO NOT TRUST SAMSUNG WATCHES
content:
Over the last year I went through two samsung watches. The first one was the gear fit which lasted 6 months and then stopped working, when I sent it to samsung they said it couldn't be fixed because its not manufactured in the US. I had bought it off Amazon and the description said it was a US version so they refunded me and I bought the more expensive gear s3 frontier because it is made for active people and supposed to be water resistant, 6 months later it stops. I sent in to samsung while still under warranty and they said it has water damage and cannot be fixed. The unit was never exposed to water, the only water I can think of is my sweat at the gym, which it is supposedly meant to be used for, being active. So I disputed this with the "disputes department" and was told the restriction was lifted and my device was authorized for repair so I sent it in again with a new ticket and label. I then get a call that it cannot be fixed again, so after speaking with multiple representatives I was told that the first ticket was not reviewed, that the authorization had not been seen and after speaking with the repair service center I was told an expedited shipping label would be sent within 24 hours for my device to be fixed. I called 24 hours later after not receiving a new ticket and shipping label and again I am told by technical support and case management that the repair was not authorized, and I was transferred back to the repair center which is now closed...

This has taken up so much time and effort. I am a loyal samsung customer, I have had multiple samsung phones and still us a galaxy s8. I help people transition to samsung after being apple users because i've trusted samsung as a brand for so long. To be honest I will never buy a samsung watch again, and I am very disappointed by the service I received. I will be calling again tomorrow to speak with the service center and hopefully get this cleared up and have my watch fixed.

I would definitely not recommend wasting your money on a samsung watch, they do not last.

title: Bad battery
content: Horrible battery what us the point of a watch If you have to charge it every couple of hrs...

author: P-Dub
title: Nice looking watch
content: Amazing watch.  Works fantastic as a watch and has tons of functionality, looks very nice too.  Haven't got to do everything I want to yet, but I love it.  Accurate sport tracking and health monitoring make it useful for tracking steps and heart rate.  Load my Spotify on it and can control my music without my phone.  Phone function works well too. author: Johnny_Amazon®
title: Beautiful, Rugged, Versatile Smart Watch
content:
The last smart watch I bought before this one was the Samsung Gear S - Samsung Gear S SM-R750 (S/K) Curved Super AMOLED Smart Watch (Black) - International Version No Warranty - which I thought had the best combination of looks, price, and functionality. I have the 3G version which included a SIM slot for its own cell line in case you wanted to detach it from your Samsung phone and use it as a standalone phone. Therefore, this review is mainly between these two watches.

First off, let's talk about the aspects where the original Gear S wins over the S3. The original Gear S is noticeable lighter, and feels more comfortable around your wrist, especially if you have smaller wrists. The curved design of the Gear S also makes it easier to see the watch face, and easier to use - your presses and swipes feel easier and more natural. I also like the band which comes with the Gear S, as it makes wearing it and taking it off a much simpler, faster, and easier process - I can pretty much wear and take off the Gear S in about 1 second, whereas it would take me about 2-3 seconds to take off the S3, and about 5 seconds to put it on because you have to hook it into the hole, and then slide the tongue underneathe the two holding bands.

However, I prefer the S3 in these areas: It feels faster and snappier to use. Also, since it has newer technologies, the apps that come with it feels more modern and robust. Tizen has come a long way since the very first original Gear, and although it still has a long ways to go, at least you can see some slight improvements. Ultimately though, I feel Tizen is taking too long to progress, and will soon be forgotten, or relegated to being a smart watch OS only, and not something that can be used on phones. The screen of the Gear S3 feels brighter and more colorful, no doubt the progression of Samsung's watch OLED technology. The rotating bezel and extra button on the S3 also make using the S4 easier, and gives it more functionality. Maybe it is just my watch, but I would like the bezel to rotate with more clamping force, as it feels too loose and easy to accidentally be moved. The watch face of the S3 looks and feels much more premium than the older S, as the metal parts make it look like a more expensive rugged watch, as opposed to the Gear S' more elegant 007/Dick Tracy spy watch style design. I also think the speaker on the S3 is just a tad louder than the Gear S. The S3 also has more and better watch faces than the Gear S.

In the end, I decided to keep both watches, for different occasions. The Gear S3 is my everyday watch, while the Gear S is more suited for a jog or something where you don't watch a big thick heavy watch to weigh you down.

author: Michael
title: Awesome smartwatch
content: I love my watch!  The first one I got, the bezel got messed up in the first 5 days.  I got a replacement with great ease via Amazon!  I love the display and apps you can download to the watch.  I also love how I can dictate txt messages.  I call people using the watch and everyone says they can hear me well.  I would highly recommend it to anyone that's looking for a smart watch.  It counts my steps and checks my pulse.  It synchronizes with my S Health app.

author: Bill Lett
title: so-so
content: The part of the charger that actually plugs into the wall was not included.  Downloaded the manual from the web but had some trouble setting up the watch.  Still not able to make "wake-up gesture" work although watch says it's on.  Reasonably satisfied with overall function.

author: ash317
title: Great watch, great price.
content: Does more than the over priced iwatch. Very pleased with the style and functionality.

author: Brian Cohen
title: Connected Samsung Gears S3 with iPhone
content: The biggest issue was battery life...not existent.  Advertised as 2 -3 day battery life.  Yet connecting to iPhone, I could not get 1 day.  I would charge the watch in the morning, and it would be discharged by bedtime.  Returned the watch for a refund.

author: ziltor238
title: Great watch awesome uses
content: I like this watch because its functional apps and various uses and as a person with larger feartures the larger size of the watch suites my wrist

author: SD Cardsmith

content: Better than expected. A couple of glitches with the widgets but all in all a terrific purchase and I'm very pleased. Especially like the Text Notifications, Reminders, Quick News...lots of features. Please Fix the Floors counter! Could be helpful if accurate.

content: I have had this watch for 20 months or so. It was a great buy in the beginning and I really loved it. As time went by, it became less and less functional. Battery life sucks. All the features, etc. He really likes how much it helps him while he's on the (factory)job: makes and received phone calls, reads and sends texts etc. all with his phone in his pocket.

author: Jorge Quintela

author: Philip

content: Bought refurbished looked brand new when it came! Great quality! Screen is very scratch resistant and band is fairly tough yet flexible. I am not a very techy guy but this watch is still pretty easy to figure out....and good grief does it have a lot of different things you can do with it like Samsung pay, texting, calling, gallery, weather, barometer, etc.....and the list goes on and on. author: danielsan

content: battery is nowhere near Amazefit Bip's level (Amazefit lasts 45 days, no joke) but it tracks sleep like a charm and has the Magnetic secure transmission (MST) technology so I can pay in places with my watch where they dont take NCF payments (google, apple, samsung, etc...) by placing the watch where the actual card reader is.

title: Average watch. Great size.
content:
I have been pretty satisfied with the frontier smart watch from Samsung.

It does an okay job tracking my sleep. Sometimes it will record sleep whenever I'm sitting for long periods of time like at the movies.

Step count has been accurate, but battery life does not compart vs the 42 MM Samsung Gear Smart Watch.

One of the features I've enjoyed most is having phone conversations from the phone. Nobody has ever complained about lack of sound or volume. Lastly, the alarm does a stand up job of waking me up in the morning.

author: H. J. Elston
title: Nice gadget - one hiccup in 4 weeks of use
content: Purchased as an add on with my new Galaxy S8 phone.  I wanted one that was "off the system" and bluetooth only - a feature that was not available where I purchased my phone.  So far, I've had only one glitch in 4 weeks of use:  There was a 48 hour period of rapid battery drain after a system update.  I performed a complete hard reset of the watch and it functioned perfectly afterwards.  Battery life is about 2-2.5 days (as opposed to 3+ days in the advertising)  between recharges but that may be due to some of my system settings.  All in all, it's a nice gadget.

author: Pook
title: Returning - not worth the headache
content: Really wanted to like this product. Just spent 3 hours trying to get it up and running forget it. First  Issue. Watch arrived with Korean language as default so finding where to change over to english was so difficult. 2nd issues... Would not connect with blue tooth to the phone.3rd Issue...stuck in a permanent Reboot mode. If it's this difficult just starting it, then forget it. Save yourself some frustration and headaches.

author: KD
title: NOT RELIABLE
content: When the watch works, its quite a good smartwatch.  However I have had numerous problems with sensors, step counts to battery issues.  Unfortunately Samsung are particularly USELESS here and give the usual response (regardless of the countless blogs and updates on the Internet).  For $200 to $250 watch this is not acceptable and I would NOT buy again as I am now dealing with another issue.  On contacting Samsung I was told to bring it to a supplier or preferred support vendor, who will charge a minimum of $70 to look at it plus parts.

author: Heather Smith
title: Great watch, but short battery and VERY laggy
content: There are a ton of features on this watch, but what good are they if it takes a good 10 seconds to actually get the thing to turn on?  The lag has made it practically useless for quick glances and telling the time. Once I'm past the initial lag spike I suppose it works pretty well. Battery only lasts 2-3 days as well.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Voice command doesnt always work
content: Got this as a gift for a significant other. He loved it! Only complaint is voice command doesnt always understand what he is saying. It also is a battery drainer.

author: MR. SAM
title: I thought hard and long whether to buy a smartwatch or not
content: I thought hard and long whether to buy a smart watch or not, however after reading so many reviews and comments about smart watches I made up my mind and went for the Samsung Gear S3 Frontier. It seemed a bit price but now that I have it, its worth every penny spent. so many faces available for down load, alerts me on text, emails, social media, Samsung health, heart rate monitor, fitness alerts, altimeter, so much more. I can make calls and receive calls from my watch, see whose calling without taking the phone out of my pocket. so much with ever touching my phone. The size is great for me, bold and confident looking on my wrist. the screen is clear and great resolution. the battery last up to 48 hours depending on usage, the bezel feels great and works just fine. its my fist smart watch and i think i made the right choice.

author: JERMAINE LEWIS
title: Great watch
content: I had this watch before and I loved it but I went into the pool with the watch and that was the end of that lol.  This watch is water resistant but not waterproof. So I Purchased my 2nd watch from Amazon and for some reason the watch did not connect to my iPhone. They sent me another watch and it had a scratch on it. I did return that one as well that is why I gave a 1 star. But it’s a great watch if you can buy it with no issues.

author: Matt
title: Amazing Smartwatch
content:
Very durable and user friendly watch!

I bought this around 2 years ago and it still works like brand new.

I have yet to experience any issues with it. Despite some minor bumps and banging it around, nothing has gotten damaged.

Worst that has happened is a few cosmetic blemishes which I've learned to live with, but no cracked screens or band damage.

They are constantly releasing software updates to make this watch even better after you buy it. I would definitely recommend it for Android users!

author: Vedran G.

content: Worst ever...dont buy...as soon as I have updated the software ,doesnt turn on anylonger, even if it does ,battery drains if charges in first place so fast. Samsung is not responding, Amazon help please. I bought it few years ago and was fine. All of a sudden after upgrade it become unresponsive.

author: Terri
title: Good watch
content: Used frontier was in great condition. The battery isn't what it's said to be.

author: codefenix
title: Great at everything but stairs
content:
I've had it for a few weeks and really like it.

First, it looks great. The face is customizable, albeit limited in its customization options. I personally prefer an analog chronograph face, so I'm currently using the Urban Classic one.  I just wish I could assign each individual complication, rather than select a firm set of three.

It's great for tracking steps and sleep, and serves as a second screen for messages and emails.  I like keeping my phone in my pocket during walks and still seeing my steps and messages on my wrist.

I really like how it auto-detects when I've been walking for 10 minutes and encourages me to "keep it up," and automatically includes it in my day's exercise log.

One area where it really falls short is tracking stairs.  It doesn't track flights of stairs climbed with any consistency whatsoever.  Sometimes it will count a particular staircase once, twice, or not at all.  I've therefore learned to ignore this stat when viewing my Samsung Health goals.

author: Liz
title: Would buy again!
content: Pretty solid. Purchased the renewed edition through amazon recommended seller and could be more pleased.

author: Scott Carroll
title: They ship the wrong watch
content: Just opened the product as I was out of town and this is not a Samsung Gear S3 Frontier but the sport 2. So so disappointed.

author: Kalyanbojja
title: Good one good design comes in black metal
content: Black metal and good looking watch, latest series does not have the same black metal. good buy if you are okay with old version.

author: Kman
title: Awesome watch to go with my Note 8

I been looking into getting this watch, and kept an eye on the price of the used/refurb units. Now that they hover around $230, i decided to order one. I got a "like new" and wasn't disappointed. I order the Bluetooth version but the seller sent me the ATT version. Too bad because i have verizon. Haven't tried the fitness features yet.
This was an awesome buy

it  is my first review on amazon , i bought this watch on sale it was 279 dollars , i bought it to track my movement when am running outdoors

author: Estefania Monge

content: Mi reloj se desempeña bien, puedo jugar, me entretiene le cambio las bases, puedo hablar, textear.  Me llegó de acuerdo a lo ofrecido.

author: A. J. Ross
title: It is the best watch I have ever owned
content: I've had this watch for about 6 months.  It is the best watch I have ever owned.  I bought the watch for the fitness tracking features.  The smart phone interaction features were of secondary importance to me.  However, I find myself using the smart phone features quite a bit.  They work great.  And the fitness tracking features are better than a dedicated fitness tracker.  The watch is very attractive.  I often get comments and questions about it.  The turn dial to access the menu items is brilliant.  My only quibble is that I wish it had an app for voice recording.

title: nice watch

DANGIT! it is Samsung specific, so it does not function the same and other android watches. it is very similar. I like it, however I wish I would have gotten the new version or another android watch.  sincs to my sasmsung phone perfectly.

author: Chris
title: Could be 5 Stars, still a great watch and device.
content:
One issue is battery life,  wish it was better.
It lasts a day when loaded up with widgets, and health monitors etc.  But can last 3 days with the display sensitivity dialed down and fewer widgets operating.

author: Morales
title: Gear 3 Frontier is a solid buy
content:
First higher end smart watch that ive owned and after a month I am very pleased.  I have a very busy schedule and this watch paired with my phone is a great combination.  The watch has impressed me from the office to the gym and I have been using it daily.  Battery life is good with it lasting 3 days before charging and I try and use as many functions as it currently has (minus games).
The only negative I have with this watch is the lack of apps available and the voice commands could use some work as well.  I would love to see a better integration between music apps and the device with better control options and possibly an amazon music gear app and a Google music gear app.  For me the ability to selet different albums and Playlist from the gear frontier while running without having to reach for the phone would be a bonus.
If you are looking for a new smart watch this is definitely one to consider.

author: Manesh
title: Plan on not being able to use the warranty if you buy it from Amazon.
content: The watch worked perfectly until it got stuck at just the loading screen to get to the watch face after 6 months of using it. I went to amazon for the warranty support provided with the device for one year, and they instructed me to call the Samsung number. At this point I had done that and Samsung said the device was an international one, so Samsung is thus unable to service it. So, now I am sitting with a piece of scrap metal that costs almost $300, that is under warranty for a year and is unable to be fixed by Samsung and Amazon.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is an amazing companion device
content: It is an amazing companion device.  I get all my notifications on here. And in doing so, I do not have to worry about picking-up/getting out my phone.  Plus I can text with it with quick replies--which is always hugely convenient for me.  And I can also store music on here as well.  Good investment for my needs.  Granted, there are many other models of smartwatches out there and if you are price concerned you may want to consider them, but in all honesty, this watch cannot disappoint you. It is just that good.

author: Worf
title: Watch was a gift, but the company has been very responsive.
content: I originally blasted this order since I got a card in my order indicating that the product I received was a refurbished item. However, I've since received confirmation that the product was indeed the new item that I was expecting and the shipping company (Kanga Supply) included the card as a means of contacting them. I very much appreciate their willingness to make contact easy, and they reached out very quickly to resolve the confusion. I would suggest that they modify their card to not indicate a refurbished status if that's not the case, but that is a very minor quarrel at this point. If you get a similar card, trust that they are shipping what you asked for, and contact them if there is a question.

author: Bootney Lee Farnsworth
title: Waste of money.
content: I honestly could not come up with a reason to justify having half my phone on my wrist, especially at $200. So if you're stupid with your money, this is a great nothing to waste your money on. There is literally nothing practical that this thing offers if your phone is always in your pocket. The 1 review where the guy broke his arm and couldn't get to his phone was hilarious, but its not like he couldn't have moved to his phone with a broken arm. Trust me, I've done more with a broken leg. So.....if you have 200 bucks to blow on a novelty....don't. Donate it to the homeless. You don't need a phone on your wrist.

author: M  Wright
title: Not exactly the item stated.
content:
Not exactly the item stated, I purchased this watch which I will say was refurbished (a bit cheaper), and after setting it up, I found out there are actually two different models of this watch, the SM-R760, and SM-R765 (which includes the LTE function). So the ad I purchased did not clearly specify the model other then the name Frontier G3, and thus I do not have the LTE function and cannot connect directly to Verizon, and must use the WI-FI and Bluetooth functionality. This defeats the purpose of the watch, since I have to carry around my cell phone as well, and it draws heavily on the battery of the phone using all these services enabled.

I would appreciate it if Amazons sellers provide the proper details to help its customers make the correct decisions on these expensive products, as not all of us are rocket scientists and understand all the nuances of the tech world. On the other side, I do find the watch to be very attractive and new-age tech type. Its other feature are actually quite nice and make some operations very easy to perform. I especially like the Note feature which allows speech recognition instead of just typing, and it appears to be very accurate. I love the Samsung PAY feature, where you can just press and pay at local credit card machines in your favorite stores. It works almost everywhere.

author: Ed
title: Not the US version.  No Samsung pay.
content: The watch I received came with Spanish as the standard language.  It's not the US version.  It does not have Samsung pay.  This is the second Samsung watch I received from Amazon that did not fit the description in the listing.  Time to order from somewhere else.

author: Daniel Mitchell

author: GOMERA

author: Tp626

content:
Biggest downfall currently is lack of quality apps.
They need to integrate google apps onto device since samsung phones are android based. Google apps are better than samsung apps.

author: Oz Gilat
title: Great for sports, good as cellphone helper
content: Great for running and swimming. It syncs with the cell phone and you can even talk through it rather clearly. Wish the battery lasted more than day and a half..

author: Dylan
title: Pretty useful!
content:
I received this watch around Thursday or so. I bought because it looks neat and secretly, I've always wanted to be a spy. This watch definitely does not have a flame thrower or a grappling hook attached but that won't detract a star. What it does have is seamless bluetooth connectivity with my Galaxy S9+, and the ability to still stay connected while my phone is connected to my car stereo. Noice!

It also has a sort of Pedometer thing, one of those features that health nuts use to track their foot steps. I was laying in bed watching YouTube videos and eating peanut butter M&Ms when I suddenly got a notification that said "Good job, you walked 800 steps, keep it up!" Or something to that effect. I was working out and getting health while not walking anywhere and shoving handfuls of M&Ms in my mouth! Another win!

Overall, a neat watch that tells me what time it is, how unhealthy I am, and what Joe blow posted to my Facebook.

author: Cruise Rodriguez
title: Cool watch
content: I don't see what all the hype about smart watches is but this one is pretty cool. It last a few days on a single charge and keeps a more accurate detail on sleep and heart rate with samsung health. Pretty disappointing that I paid this much and it dont take blood pressure. Overall so far it's a good purchase.
